str2: A primary particle; properly, at the 'same' time, but freely used as a preposition or adverb denoting close association.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From peri and erchomai; to come all around, i.e. Stroll, vacillate, veer.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Prating, talking foolishly, babbling. From phluo; a garrulous person, i.e. Prater.
From peri and ergon; working all around, i.e. Officious.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
